answers.text: A collection of vertices and edges
A tree with vertices connected by paths
A network of computers
A set of independent vertices

questions.question: Which of the following is not a type of graph?

answers.text: A directed graph
An undirected graph
A cyclic graph
A star graph

questions.question: In a graph, what do vertices represent?

answers.text: Nodes or points
Connections between nodes
Edges between vertices
Paths in the graph

questions.question: What is the degree of a vertex in an undirected graph?

answers.text: The number of edges connected to the vertex
The number of adjacent vertices
The number of nodes in the graph
The number of loops on the vertex

questions.question: Which of the following terms is used to describe a graph with no cycles?

answers.text: A tree
A complete graph
A bipartite graph
A connected graph

questions.question: What is the difference between a directed and an undirected graph?

answers.text: A directed graph has edges with a direction, whereas an undirected graph has edges without direction
A directed graph has more vertices than an undirected graph
An undirected graph can only have weighted edges
A directed graph has no loops, but an undirected graph can have them

questions.question: What is an example of a complete graph?

answers.text: A graph where every pair of distinct vertices is connected by a unique edge
A graph where all vertices have the same degree
A graph with no edges
A graph with exactly one cycle
A graph whose vertices can be divided into two disjoint sets such that no two vertices within the same set are adjacent
A graph with exactly two edges connected to each vertex
A graph with an equal number of vertices in each set
A graph with only two vertices

questions.question: Which of the following is a property of a connected graph?

answers.text: There is a path between every pair of vertices
There is exactly one cycle in the graph
All vertices have the same degree
There are no edges between vertices

questions.question: What is the adjacency matrix of a graph?

answers.text: A matrix that represents the connections between vertices
A matrix that lists all the vertices of the graph
A matrix that represents the degree of each vertex
A matrix used to store weights of edges in a graph
